desc: While undetected by all non-allies in underbrush terrain, you can Sneak without attempting a Stealth check as long as you move no more than 5 feet and do not move within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during your movement. This also allows you to automatically approach creatures to within 15 feet while Avoiding Notice during exploration as long as they aren't actively Searching or on guard.
hint: While undetected by all non-allies in underbrush terrain, you can Sneak without attempting a Stealth check as long as you move no more than 5 feet and do not move within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during your movement. This also allows you to automatically approach creatures to within 15 feet while Avoiding Notice during exploration as long as they aren't actively Searching or on guard.
shortdesc: Sneak in underbrush terrain without attempting a check.

name: Terrified Retreat
desc: When you critically succeed at the Demoralize action, if the target's level is lower than yours, the target is fleeing for 1 round.
hint: When you critically succeed at the Demoralize action, if the target's level is lower than yours, the target is fleeing for 1 round.
shortdesc: Cause foes you Demoralize to flee.

name: Thickcoat Shoony
desc: You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.
hint: You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on). Unless you wear protective gear or take shelter, environmental heat effects are one step more extreme for you.
shortdesc: You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes.

name: Thickcoat Shoony Perception
desc: You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow.
hint: You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target a concealed creature if that creature is concealed only by snow.
shortdesc: You are a rare shoony who hails from colder climes.

name: Tiger Slash
desc: You make a fierce swipe with both hands.
shortdesc: You make a fierce swipe with both hands.

name: Tiger Stance
desc: You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks.
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks.

name: Timeless Body
desc: You cease aging. In addition, you gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against poisons and diseases, and you gain resistance to poison damage equal to half your level.
hint: You gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against poisons and diseases.
shortdesc: You cease aging.

name: Titan Wrestler
desc: You can attempt to Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip creatures up to two sizes larger than you, or up to three sizes larger than you if you're legendary in Athletics.
hint: You can attempt to Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip creatures up to two sizes larger than you, or up to three sizes larger than you if you're legendary in Athletics.
shortdesc: Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip larger creatures.

name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
desc: You have transcended the barriers between words and meaning. You can speak and understand all spoken languages.
shortdesc: You have transcended the barriers between words and meaning.

onceEffects.value: All spoken languages (Tongue of the Sun and Moon)

name: Toughness
desc: You can withstand more punishment than most before succumbing. Increase your maximum Hit Points by your level. The DC of recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying condition value.
hint: The DC of recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying condition value.
shortdesc: Increase your maximum HP and reduce the DCs of recovery checks.

name: Train Animal
desc: Teach an animal a trick.
shortdesc: Teach an animal a trick.

name: Treedweller Goblin
desc: You have adapted particularly well to living in forested environments. As long as you are in a forest or jungle, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak, Survival checks to Subsist, and your Survival DC to Cover Tracks.
hint: As long as you are in a forest or jungle, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak, Survival checks to Subsist, and your Survival DC to Cover Tracks.
shortdesc: You have adapted particularly well to living in forested environments.

name: Trick Magic Item
desc: Activate a magic item you normally can't activate.
shortdesc: Activate a magic item you normally can't activate.

name: Tweak Appearances
desc: You spend 1 minute making quick adjustments to someone's clothing and appearance, causing their words to carry more weight with an audience of your choice. While speaking to that audience, the target gains a +1 item bonus to Diplomacy and Performance checks. If you have master proficiency in Crafting, the bonus increases to +2; if you have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the bonus increases to +3. This bonus lasts until this ability is used on the target again, the situation they were prepared for ends, or they next change their outfit.
hint: You can spend 1 minute making quick adjustments to someone's clothing and appearance, causing their words to carry more weight with an audience of your choice. While speaking to that audience, the target gains a +1 item bonus to Diplomacy and Performance checks. If you have master proficiency in Crafting, the bonus increases to +2; if you have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the bonus increases to +3. This bonus lasts until this ability is used on the target again, the situation they were prepared for ends, or they next change their outfit.
shortdesc: You can alter a creature's clothing to improve their social impact.

name: Unbreakable Goblin
desc: You're able to bounce back from injuries easily due to an exceptionally thick skull, cartilaginous bones, or some other mixed blessing. You gain 10 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 6. When you fall, reduce the falling damage you take as though you had fallen half the distance.
hint: When you fall, reduce the falling damage you take as though you had fallen half the distance.
shortdesc: You're able to bounce back from injuries easily due to an exceptionally thick skull, cartilaginous bones, or some other mixed blessing.

name: Underwater Marauder
desc: You've learned to fight underwater. You are not flat-footed while in water, and you don't take the usual penalties for using a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in water.
hint: You are not flat-footed while in water, and you don't take the usual penalties for using a bludgeoning or slashing melee weapon in water.
shortdesc: Fight more effectively underwater.

name: Unified Theory
desc: You've started to make a meaningful connection about the common underpinnings of the four traditions of magic and magical essences, allowing you to understand them all through an arcane lens. Whenever you use an action or a skill feat that requires a Nature, Occultism, or Religion check, depending on the magic tradition, you can use Arcana instead. If you would normally take a penalty or have a higher DC for using Arcana on other magic (such as when using Identify Magic), you no longer do so.
hint: Whenever you use an action or a skill feat that requires a Nature, Occultism, or Religion check, depending on the magic tradition, you can use Arcana instead. If you would normally take a penalty or have a higher DC for using Arcana on other magic (such as when using Identify Magic), you no longer do so.
shortdesc: Use Arcana for checks for all magical traditions.

name: Unmistakable Lore
desc: You never get information about your areas of expertise wrong. When you Recall Knowledge using any Lore subcategory in which you're trained, if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you're a master in a Lore subcategory, on a critical success, you gain even more information or context than usual.
hint: When you Recall Knowledge using any Lore subcategory in which you're trained, if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you're a master in a Lore subcategory, on a critical success, you gain even more information or context than usual.
shortdesc: Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.

name: Untrained Improvisation
desc: You've learned how to handle situations when you're out of your depth. Your proficiency bonus to untrained skill checks is equal to half your level instead of +0. If you're 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to your full level instead. This doesn't allow you to use the skill's trained actions.
shortdesc: Become more adept at using untrained skills.

name: Vine Leshy
desc: The prehensile vines woven into your body grant you unmatched skill at climbing. You do not need to have any hands free to Climb. Additionally, if you roll a success on an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.
hint: You do not need to have any hands free to Climb. Additionally, if you roll a success on an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.
shortdesc: The prehensile vines woven into your body grant you unmatched skill at climbing.

name: Virtuosic Performer
desc: You have exceptional talent with one type of performance. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making a certain type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. Select one of the following specialties and apply the bonus when attempting Performance checks of that type. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with a certain type of Performance.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Acting
desc: You have exceptional talent with acting performances, such as drama, pantomime or puppetry. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making acting performances, such as drama, pantomime or puppetry. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with acting performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Comedy
desc: You have exceptional talent with comedy performances, such as buffoonery, joke telling or limericks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making comedy performances, such as buffoonery, joke telling or limericks. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with comedy performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Dance
desc: You have exceptional talent with dance performances, such as ballet, huara, jig or macru. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making dance performances, such as ballet, huara, jig or macru. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with dance performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Keyboards
desc: You have exceptional talent with keyboard performances, such as harpsichord, organ or piano. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making keyboard performances, such as harpsichord, organ or piano. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with keyboards performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Oratory
desc: You have exceptional talent with oratory performances, such as epic, ode, poetry or storytelling. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making oratory performances, such as epic, ode, poetry or storytelling. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with oratory performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Percussion
desc: You have exceptional talent with percussion performances, such as chimes, drum, gong or xylophone. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making percussion performances, such as chimes, drum, gong or xylophone. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with percussion performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Singing
desc: You have exceptional talent with singing performances, such as ballad, chant, melody or rhyming. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making singing performances, such as ballad, chant, melody or rhyming. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with singing performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Strings
desc: You have exceptional talent with strings performances, such as fiddle, harp, lute or viol. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making strings performances, such as fiddle, harp, lute or viol. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with strings performances.

name: Virtuosic Performer: Winds
desc: You have exceptional talent with winds performances, such as bagpipe, flute, recorder or trumpet. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making this type of performance. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus when making winds performances, such as bagpipe, flute, recorder or trumpet. If you are a master in Performance, this bonus increases to +2. If it's unclear whether the specialty applies, the GM decides.
shortdesc: +1 with winds performances.

name: Vivacious Gnome
desc: You have an incredibly strong connection to the positive energy that flows through the First World, making it harder to attack your life force with negative energy. You gain negative resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1). When you have the doomed condition, the condition affects you as if its value was 1 lower than it actually is (doomed 1 has no effect, doomed 2 causes you to die at dying 3, and so on).
hint: When you have the doomed condition, the condition affects you as if its value was 1 lower than it actually is (doomed 1 has no effect, doomed 2 causes you to die at dying 3, and so on).
shortdesc: You have an incredibly strong connection to the positive energy that flows through the First World, making it harder to attack your life force with negative energy.

name: Wall Jump
desc:
You can use your momentum from a jump to propel yourself off a wall. If you're adjacent to a wall at the end of a jump (whether performing a High Jump, Long Jump, or Leap), you don't fall as long as your next action is another jump. Furthermore, since your previous jump gives you momentum, you can use High Jump or Long Jump as a single action, but you don't get to Stride as part of the activity.

You can use Wall Jump only once in a turn, unless you're legendary in Athletics, in which case you can use Wall Jump as many times as you can use consecutive jump actions in that turn.
hint:
If you're adjacent to a wall at the end of a jump (whether performing a High Jump, Long Jump, or Leap), you don't fall as long as your next action is another jump. Furthermore, since your previous jump gives you momentum, you can use High Jump or Long Jump as a single action, but you don't get to Stride as part of the activity.

You can use Wall Jump only once in a turn, unless you're legendary in Athletics, in which case you can use Wall Jump as many times as you can use consecutive jump actions in that turn.
shortdesc: Jump off walls.

name: Wall Run
desc: You defy gravity, traversing vertical planes as easily as the ground.
shortdesc: You defy gravity, traversing vertical planes as easily as the ground.

name: Ward Medic
desc: You've studied in large medical wards, treating several patients at once and tending to all their needs. When you use Treat Disease or Treat Wounds, you can treat up to two targets. If you're a master in Medicine, you can treat up to four targets, and if you're legendary, you can treat up to eight targets.
hint: When you use Treat Disease or Treat Wounds, you can treat up to two targets. If you're a master in Medicine, you can treat up to four targets, and if you're legendary, you can treat up to eight targets.
shortdesc: Treat several patients at once.

name: Warmarch Hobgoblin
desc: You come from a line of wandering mercenaries, constantly on the march and scavenging food on the trail. If you fail, but not critically fail, to Subsist in the wilderness, you can still keep yourself fed with poor meals.
hint: If you fail, but not critically fail, to Subsist in the wilderness, you can still keep yourself fed with poor meals.
shortdesc: You come from a line of wandering mercenaries, constantly on the march and scavenging food on the trail.

name: Warmarch Hobgoblin Hustle
desc: You come from a line of wandering mercenaries, constantly on the march and scavenging food on the trail. When exploring, you can Hustle twice as long before you have to stop.
hint: When exploring, you can Hustle twice as long before you have to stop.
shortdesc: You come from a line of wandering mercenaries, constantly on the march and scavenging food on the trail.

name: Warrenbred Hobgoblin
desc: Your ancestors lived underground. Your ears are larger than those of other hobgoblins and sensitive to echoes. If you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to Squeeze, you get a critical success instead.
hint: If you roll a success on an Acrobatics check to Squeeze, you get a critical success instead.
shortdesc: Your ancestors lived underground.

name: Warrenbred Hobgoblin Perception
desc: Your ancestors lived underground. Your ears are larger than those of other hobgoblins and sensitive to echoes. When you are underground, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures within a 30-foot burst instead of a 15-foot burst.
hint: When you are underground, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures within a 30-foot burst instead of a 15-foot burst.
shortdesc: Your ancestors lived underground.

name: Wary Disarmament
desc: If you trigger a device or set off a trap while disarming it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC or saving throw against the device or trap. This applies only to attacks or effects triggered by your failed attempt, not to any later ones, such as additional attacks from a complex trap.
hint: If you trigger a device or set off a trap while disarming it, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC or saving throw against the device or trap. This applies only to attacks or effects triggered by your failed attempt, not to any later ones, such as additional attacks from a complex trap.
shortdesc: +2 to AC or saves against devices or traps you trigger while disarming.

name: Water Step
desc: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don't support your weight. This benefit lasts only during your movement. If you end your movement on a surface that can't support you, you fall in or it collapses as normal.
hint: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don't support your weight. This benefit lasts only during your movement. If you end your movement on a surface that can't support you, you fall in or it collapses as normal.
shortdesc: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don't support your weight.

name: Weapon Proficiency
desc: You become trained in all simple weapons. If you were already trained in all simple weapons, you become trained in all martial weapons. If you were already trained in all martial weapons, you become trained in one advanced weapon of your choice.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you do, you become trained in additional weapons as appropriate, following the above progression.
shortdesc: Become trained in a weapon type.

name: Weapon Proficiency: Advanced Weapon
desc: You become trained in the Advanced Weapon.
shortdesc: Become trained in a weapon type.
specialreq: !characterService.get_Skills(character, this.subType).length || characterService.get_Skills(character, this.subType)[0].level(character, characterService) < 2 || (this.have(character, characterService, charLevel) && characterService.get_Skills(character, this.subType)[0].level(character, characterService, charLevel) < 4)

name: Wetlander Lizardfolk
desc: Your family is descended from the most common lizardfolk heritage, and you are accustomed to aquatic environments. You gain a 15-foot swim Speed.
shortdesc: Your family is descended from the most common lizardfolk heritage, and you are accustomed to aquatic environments.

name: Whirling Throw
desc: You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance.
shortdesc: You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance.

name: Whisper Elf
desc: Your ears are finely tuned, able to detect even the slightest whispers of sound. As long as you can hear normally, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures in a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot cone. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action.
hint: As long as you can hear normally, you can use the Seek action to sense undetected creatures in a 60-foot cone instead of a 30-foot cone. You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to locate undetected creatures that you could hear within 30 feet with a Seek action.
shortdesc: Your ears are finely tuned, able to detect even the slightest whispers of sound.

name: Wholeness of Body
desc: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki. You gain the wholeness of body ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki.

name: Wild Winds Gust
desc: You store up energy and release it in an enormous gust of rushing wind.
shortdesc: You store up energy and release it in an enormous gust of rushing wind.

name: Wild Winds Initiate
desc: You learn a mystical stance that lets you attack from a distance. You gain the wild winds stance ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1. While entering the stance is a ki spell, the wind crash Strikes the stance grants are not, so you can use them as often as you like while in the stance.
shortdesc: You learn a mystical stance that lets you attack from a distance.

name: Wilderness Spotter
desc: Select one type of terrain from the following list: aquatic, arctic, desert, forest, mountain, plains, sky, swamp, or underground. You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in the selected terrain in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in the chosen terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, the feat applies to a new type of terrain.
shortdesc: Use Survival for your Initiative when in a specific terrain.

name: Wilderness Spotter: Aquatic
desc: You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in Use Survival for your Initiative when in aquatic terrain. in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in this terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.
hint: You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in Use Survival for your Initiative when in aquatic terrain. in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in this terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.
shortdesc: Use Survival for your Initiative when in aquatic terrain.

name: Wilderness Spotter: Arctic
desc: You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in Use Survival for your Initiative when in arctic terrain. in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in this terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.
hint: You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in Use Survival for your Initiative when in arctic terrain. in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in this terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.
shortdesc: Use Survival for your Initiative when in arctic terrain.

name: Wilderness Spotter: Desert
desc: You can use Survival in place of Perception to roll initiative when in Use Survival for your Initiative when in desert terrain. in a natural location (not a structure) even if you weren't tracking or otherwise using Survival before the encounter. You can also use Survival instead of Perception to notice traps in natural locations in this terrain; if you find a snare in this way, you can also use Survival instead of Thievery to Disable the Device.

name: Wildwood Halfling
desc: You hail from deep in a jungle or forest, and you've learned how to use your small size to wriggle through undergrowth, vines, and other obstacles. You ignore difficult terrain from trees, foliage, and undergrowth.
hint: You ignore difficult terrain from trees, foliage, and undergrowth.
shortdesc: You hail from deep in a jungle or forest, and you've learned how to use your small size to wriggle through undergrowth, vines, and other obstacles.

name: Wind Jump
desc: You gather the wind beneath you, allowing you to soar as you jump. You gain the wind jump ki spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You gather the wind beneath you, allowing you to soar as you jump.

name: Winding Flow
desc: Any journey consists of more than simply reaching your destination.
shortdesc: Any journey consists of more than simply reaching your destination.

name: Wintertouched Human
desc: The power of winter flows through you. This heritage is most common among the Jadwiga of Irrisen, due to their descent from Baba Yaga, and certain Erutaki touched by the spirits. You gain cold resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and you treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).
hint: You treat environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible cold becomes extreme, extreme cold becomes severe, and so on).
shortdesc: The power of winter flows through you.

name: Wolf Drag
desc: You rip your enemy off their feet.
shortdesc: You rip your enemy off their feet.

name: Wolf Stance
desc: You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth.
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth.

name: Woodland Elf Climbing
desc: You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. When Climbing trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have Quick Climb). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed.
hint: When Climbing trees, vines, and other foliage, you move at half your Speed on a success and at full Speed on a critical success (and you move at full Speed on a success if you have Quick Climb). This doesn't affect you if you're using a climb Speed.
shortdesc: You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage.

name: Woodland Elf Cover
desc: You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage. You can always use the Take Cover action when you are within forest terrain to gain cover, even if you're not next to an obstacle you can Take Cover behind.
hint: You can always use the Take Cover action when you are within forest terrain to gain cover, even if you're not next to an obstacle you can Take Cover behind.
shortdesc: You're adapted to life in the forest or the deep jungle, and you know how to climb trees and use foliage to your advantage.

name: Animal Instinct
desc:
The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks. Cultures that revere vicious animals (such as apes or bears) give rise to barbarians with this instinct. You might also be at war with an uncontrollable, animalistic side of your personality, or you might be a descendant of a werewolf or another werecreature. Select an animal that best matches your chosen animal. Ape: Melee Fist (grapple), Damage 1d10 bludgeoning. Bear: Melee Jaws, Damage 1d10 piercing; Melee Claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing. Bull: Melee Horn (shove), Damage 1d10 piercing. Cat: Melee Jaws, Damage 1d10 piercing; Melee Claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing. Deer: Melee Antler (grapple), Damage 1d10 piercing. Frog: Melee Jaws, Damage 1d10 bludgeoning; Melee Tongue (agile), Damage 1d4 bludgeoning. Shark: Melee Jaws (grapple), Damage 1d10 piercing. Snake: Melee Fangs (grapple), Damage 1d10 piercing. Wolf: Melee Jaws (trip), Damage 1d10 piercing.
Anathema
Flagrantly disrespecting an animal of your chosen kind is anathema to your instinct, as is using weapons while raging.
Bestial Rage (Instinct Ability)
When you Rage, you gain your chosen animal's unarmed attack (or attacks). The specific attack gained, the damage it deals, and its traits are listed on Table 3-3: Animal Instincts. These attacks are in the brawling group. Your Rage action gains the morph, primal, and transmutation traits.
Specialization Ability
Increase the damage die size for the unarmed attacks granted by your chosen animal by one step, and increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 5 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks. The frog's tongue attack and deer's antler attack gain reach 10 feet. If you have greater weapon specialization, increase the damage from Rage from 5 to 12 for your chosen animal's unarmed attacks.
Raging Resistance
You resist piercing and slashing damage.
internalNote: Many effects are coded into the rage activity and condition.
shortdesc: The fury of a wild predator fills you when you Rage, granting you ferocious unarmed attacks.

Bear: Melee Jaws, Damage 1d10 piercing; Melee Claw (agile), Damage 1d6 slashing. Bull: Melee Horn (shove), Damage 1d10 piercing. name: Dragon Instinct
desc:
You summon the fury of a mighty dragon and manifest incredible abilities. Perhaps your culture reveres draconic majesty, or you gained your connection by drinking or bathing in dragon's blood or after watching a marauding wyrm burn your village. Select a type of dragon from Table 3-4: Dragon Instincts to be your instinct's dragon type. Chromatic dragons tend to be evil, and metallic dragons tend to be good. Black: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Line of acid. Blue: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Line of electricity. Green: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of poison. Red: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of fire. White: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of cold. Brass: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of fire. Bronze: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of electricity. Copper: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of acid. Gold: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Cone of fire. Silver: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Cold of cold.
Anathema
Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your instinct. Choose whether your character respects or abhors your dragon type. If you respect it, defying such a dragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a dragon you come across is anathema.
Draconic Rage (Instinct Ability)
While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your dragon's breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your Rage action gains the arcane and evocation traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.
Specialization Ability
When you use draconic rage, you increase the additional damage from Rage from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage when using draconic rage from 8 to 16.
Raging Resistance
You resist piercing damage and the damage type of your dragon's breath weapon.
internalNote: Many effects are coded into the rage activity and condition.
shortdesc: You summon the fury of a mighty dragon and manifest incredible abilities.

name: Draconic Rage
desc: While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to match that of your dragon's breath weapon instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your Rage action gains the arcane and evocation traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type. Black: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Line of acid. Blue: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Line of electricity. Green: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of poison. Red: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of fire. White: Type Chromatic, Breath Weapon Cone of cold. Brass: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of fire. Bronze: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of electricity. Copper: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Line of acid. Gold: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Cone of fire. Silver: Type Metallic, Breath Weapon Cold of cold.

Anathema
Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your instinct. Choose whether your character respects or abhors your dragon type. If you respect it, defying such a dragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a dragon you come across is anathema.
Draconic Rage (Instinct Ability)
While raging, you can increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 4 and change its damage type to acid instead of the damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack. If you do this, your Rage action gains the arcane and evocation traits, as well as the trait matching the damage type.
Specialization Ability
When you use draconic rage, you increase the additional damage from Rage from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage when using draconic rage from 8 to 16.
Raging Resistance
You resist piercing damage and acid damage.
anathema: Letting a personal insult against you slide is anathema to your instinct.
If you respect your dragon type, defying such a dragon is anathema, and if you abhor it, failing to defeat such a dragon you come across is anathema.

name: Dragon Instinct Specialization
desc: When you use draconic rage, you increase the additional damage from Rage from 4 to 8. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage from Rage when using draconic rage from 8 to 16.

name: Dragon Instinct Resistance
desc: You resist piercing damage and the damage type of your dragon's breath weapon.

name: Fury Instinct
desc:
Your rage comes from a deep and purely personal well within you. You use your rage as you choose.
Anathema and Instinct Ability
You don't have an anathema or an instinct ability. Instead, you gain an additional 1st-level barbarian feat.
Specialization Ability
Increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 6. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the additional damage from Rage to 12.
Raging Resistance
You resist physical weapon damage, but not physical damage from other sources (such as unarmed attacks).
shortdesc: Your rage comes from a deep and purely personal well within you.

name: Fury Instinct: Extra 1st-level feat
desc: You don't have an instinct ability. Instead, you gain an additional 1st-level barbarian feat.
shortdesc: You don't have an instinct ability. Instead, you gain an additional 1st-level barbarian feat.

name: Fury Instinct Specialization
desc: Increase the additional damage from Rage from 2 to 6. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the additional damage from Rage to 12.

name: Fury Instinct Resistance
desc: You resist physical weapon damage, but not physical damage from other sources (such as unarmed attacks).

name: Giant Instinct
desc:
Your rage gives you the raw power and size of a giant. This doesn't necessarily mean you revere giants - you might scoff at them or even aspire to slay them! You could instead seem like a giant to other people due to your exceptional strength or larger-than-life emotions and ego.
Anathema
Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.
Titan Mauler (Instinct Ability)
You can use a weapon built for a Large creature if you are Small or Medium (both normally and when raging). If you're not Small or Medium, you can use a weapon built for a creature one size larger than you. You gain access to this larger weapon, of any weapon type otherwise available at character creation. It has the normal Price and Bulk for a weapon of its size. When wielding such a weapon in combat, increase your additional damage from Rage from 2 to 6, but you have the clumsy 1 condition (page 618) because of the weapon's unwieldy size. You can't remove this clumsy condition or ignore its penalties by any means while wielding the weapon.
Specialization Ability
Increase the damage from Rage when using a larger weapon from 6 to 10; if you have greater weapon specialization, increase it from 10 to 18.
Raging Resistance
You resist bludgeoning damage and your choice of cold, electricity, or fire, chosen when you gain raging resistance.
shortdesc: Your rage gives you the raw power and size of a giant.
anathema: Failing to face a personal challenge of strength is anathema.

name: Giant Instinct Resistance
desc: You resist bludgeoning damage and your choice of cold, electricity, or fire, chosen when you gain raging resistance.
shortdesc: You resist bludgeoning damage and your choice of cold, electricity, or fire, chosen when you gain raging resistance.

name: Giant Instinct Resistance: Cold
desc: You resist bludgeoning damage and cold damage.
shortdesc: You resist bludgeoning damage and cold damage.

name: Giant Instinct Resistance: Electricity
desc: You resist bludgeoning damage and electricity damage.
shortdesc: You resist bludgeoning damage and electricity damage.

name: Giant Instinct Resistance: Fire
desc: You resist bludgeoning damage and fire damage.
shortdesc: You resist bludgeoning damage and fire damage.

name: Titan Mauler
desc:

You can't remove this clumsy condition or ignore its penalties by any means while wielding the weapon.

You can set a weapon to be larger in the inventory.

name: Giant Instinct Specialization
desc: Increase the damage from Rage when using a larger weapon from 6 to 10; if you have greater weapon specialization, increase it from 10 to 18.

name: Spirit Instinct
desc:
Whether you are emotionally sensitive to the spirits around you; worship ancestors or apparitions; or are haunted by the specter of an ancestor, relative, friend, or foe, your rage takes the form of a spiritual possession.
Anathema
Disrespecting corpses or spirits is anathema to your instinct; defending yourself against undead creatures is not.
Spirit Rage (Instinct Ability)
When you are raging, you can increase your damage from Rage from 2 to 3 and deal negative or positive damage, instead of the normal damage type for your weapon or unarmed attack (choose each time you Rage). If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the ghost touch property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your Rage action gains the divine and necromancy traits, plus negative or positive, as appropriate.
Specialization Ability
When using spirit rage, increase the damage from Rage from 3 to 7. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage when using spirit rage to 13.
Raging Resistance
You resist negative damage, as well as damage dealt by the attacks and abilities of undead creatures, regardless of the damage type.
shortdesc: Whether you are emotionally sensitive to the spirits around you; worship ancestors or apparitions; or are haunted by the specter of an ancestor, relative, friend, or foe, your rage takes the form of a spiritual possession.
anathema: Disrespecting corpses or spirits is anathema to your instinct; defending yourself against undead creatures is not.

name: Spirit Rage

If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the ghost touch property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your Rage action gains the divine and necromancy traits, plus negative or positive, as appropriate.

If you choose to deal negative or positive damage, your weapon or unarmed attack gains the effects of the ghost touch property rune, which makes it more effective against incorporeal creatures, and your Rage action gains the divine and necromancy traits, plus negative or positive, as appropriate.
shortdesc: When you are raging, you can increase your damage from Rage and deal negative or positive damage.

name: Spirit Instinct Specialization
desc: When using spirit rage, increase the damage from Rage from 3 to 7. If you have greater weapon specialization, instead increase the damage when using spirit rage to 13.

name: Spirit Instinct Resistance
desc: You resist negative damage, as well as damage dealt by the attacks and abilities of undead creatures, regardless of the damage type.

name: Fighter Weapon Mastery
desc: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with your weapons of choice. Choose one weapon group. Your proficiency rank increases to master with the simple and martial weapons in that group, and to expert with the advanced weapons in that group. You gain access to the critical specialization effects (page 283) of all weapons for which you have master proficiency.
shortdesc: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with your weapons of choice.

Your proficiency rank increases to master with simple and martial spears, and to expert with advanced spears. You gain access to the critical specialization effects (page 283) of all weapons for which you have master proficiency.
shortdesc: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with spears.

name: Fighter Weapon Mastery: Sword
desc: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with swords. Your proficiency rank increases to master with simple and martial swords, and to expert with advanced swords. You gain access to the critical specialization effects (page 283) of all weapons for which you have master proficiency.
shortdesc: Hours spent training with your preferred weapons, learning and developing new combat techniques, have made you particularly effective with swords.

name: Weapon Legend
desc: You've learned fighting techniques that apply to all armaments, and you've developed unparalleled skill with your favorite weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple and martial weapons and unarmed attacks increase to master. Your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to expert. You can select one weapon group and increase your proficiency ranks to legendary for all simple and martial weapons in that weapon group, and to master for all advanced weapons in that weapon group.
shortdesc: You've learned fighting techniques that apply to all armaments, and you've developed unparalleled skill with your favorite weapons.

name: Divine Ki Spells
desc: Your ki spells are divine spells. You become trained in divine spell attacks and divine spell DCs and your key spellcasting ability is Wisdom.
shortdesc: Your ki spells are divine spells.

name: Occult Ki Spells
desc: Your ki spells are occult spells. You become trained in occult spell attacks and occult spell DCs and your key spellcasting ability is Wisdom.
shortdesc: Your ki spells are occult spells.

name: Elemental Bloodline
desc:
A genie ancestor or some other elemental influence has imbued your blood with primal fury, affecting how the bloodline spells and granted spells marked with an asterisk (*), as well as your blood magic, function.

Spell List: primal
Bloodline Skills: Intimidation, Nature
Granted Spells: cantrip produce flame*, 1st: burning hands*, 2nd: resist energy, 3rd: fireball*, 4th: freedom of movement, 5th: elemental form, 6th: repulsion, 7th: energy aegis, 8th: prismatic wall, 9th: storm of vengeance
Bloodline Spells: initial: elemental toss*, advanced: elemental motion, greater: elemental blast*
Blood Magic: Elemental energy surrounds you or a target. Either you gain a +1 status bonus to Intimidation checks for 1 round, or a target takes 1 damage per spell level. The damage is bludgeoning or fire, according to your elemental type (see below). If the spell already deals that type of damage, combine it with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances.
specialdesc: At 1st level, choose the type of elemental that influenced your bloodline: air, earth, fire, or water. If your element is air, you buffet your foes with powerful winds; if it's earth, you toss huge chunks of rock; if it's fire, you incinerate your foes with flame; and if it's water, you inundate your foes with torrents of water. For fire, all marked spells deal fire damage. For other elements, they deal bludgeoning damage. Replace any existing elemental traits with the trait of the element you chose.
shortdesc: A genie ancestor or some other elemental influence has imbued your blood with primal fury, affecting how your bloodline spells and granted spells, as well as your blood magic, function.

name: Elemental Type
desc: At 1st level, choose the type of elemental that influenced your bloodline: air, earth, fire, or water. If your element is air, you buffet your foes with powerful winds; if it's earth, you toss huge chunks of rock; if it's fire, you incinerate your foes with flame; and if it's water, you inundate your foes with torrents of water. For fire, all marked spells deal fire damage. For other elements, they deal bludgeoning damage. Replace any existing elemental traits with the trait of the element you chose.
shortdesc: At 1st level, choose the type of elemental that influenced your bloodline: air, earth, fire, or water.

name: Elemental Type: Air
desc:
You buffet your foes with powerful winds. All of the following spells deal bludgeoning damage instead of their elemental damage. Replace any existing elemental traits with the Air trait.

Burning Hands
Elemental Blast
Elemental Toss
Fireball
Produce Flame
hint: This spell deals bludgeoning damage instead of its elemental damage, and any existing elemental trait is replaced with Air.
showon: Produce Flame, Burning Hands, Fireball, Elemental Toss, Elemental Blast
shortdesc: You buffet your foes with powerful winds.

You toss huge chunks of rock at your foes. All of the following spells deal bludgeoning damage instead of their elemental damage. Replace any existing elemental traits with the Earth trait.

Burning Hands

Fireball
Produce Flame

name: Muse
desc: As a bard, you select one muse at 1st level. This muse leads you to great things, and might be a physical creature, a deity, a philosophy, or a captivating mystery.
shortdesc: As a bard, you select one muse at 1st level.

name: Composition Spells
desc:
You can infuse your performances with magic to create unique effects called compositions. Compositions are a special type of spell that often require you to use the Performance skill when casting them. Composition spells are a type of focus spell. It costs 1 Focus Point to cast a focus spell, and you start with a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. You refill your focus pool during your daily preparations, and you can regain 1 Focus Point by spending 10 minutes using the Refocus activity to perform, write a new composition, or otherwise engage your muse.

Focus spells are automatically heightened to half your level rounded up, much like cantrips. Focus spells don't require spell slots, and you can't cast them using spell slots. Taking feats can give you more focus spells and increase the size of your focus pool, though your focus pool can never hold more than 3 Focus Points. The full rules for focus spells appear on page 300.

You learn the counter performance composition spell (page 386), protecting against auditory and visual effects.
internalNote: Spell slots gained through class features are handled in the class object.
shortdesc: You can infuse your performances with magic to create unique effects called compositions.

name: Shield Warden (Champion)
desc: You use your shield to protect your allies. When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.
hint: When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.
shortdesc: You use your shield to protect your allies as well as yourself.

name: Double Slice
desc: You lash out at your foe with both weapons.
shortdesc: You lash out at your foe with both weapons.

name: Everstand Stance
desc: You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.
specialdesc: This class feat is available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the champion trait are champion class feats. Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.
shortdesc: You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.

name: Exacting Strike
desc: You make a controlled attack, fully accounting for your momentum.

desc: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly.
shortdesc: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly.

name: Power Attack
desc: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady.
shortdesc: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady.

name: Reactive Shield
desc: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second.
shortdesc: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second.

name: Snagging Strike
desc: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.
shortdesc: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.

desc: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing.
shortdesc: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing.

shortdesc: You push back as you block the attack, knocking your foe away or off balance.

shortdesc: Your blow not only wounds creatures but also shatters their confidence.

desc: Extending your body to its limits, you attack an enemy that would normally be beyond your reach.
shortdesc: Extending your body to its limits, you attack an enemy that would normally be beyond your reach.

name: Double Shot

shortdesc: You shoot twice in blindingly fast succession.

shortdesc: You snap your free hand over to grip your weapon just long enough to add momentum and deliver a more powerful blow to your opponent.

name: Everstand Strike
desc: Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.
specialdesc: This class feat is available to Knights of Lastwall. Those with the champion trait are champion class feats. Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.
shortdesc: Your follow-up blow leaves you an opening to set your shield.

name: Knockdown
desc: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.
hint: If the Strike made during Knockdown hits and deals damage, you can attempt an Athletics check to Trip the creature you hit. If you're wielding a two-handed melee weapon, you can ignore Trip's requirement that you have a hand free.
shortdesc: You make an attack to knock a foe off balance, then follow up immediately with a sweep to topple them.

name: Powerful Shove
desc:
You can push larger foes around with your attack. You can use Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you Shove has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1). This happens regardless of how you Shoved the creature.
hint:
You can use Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove against a creature up to two sizes larger than you.

When a creature you Shove has to stop moving because it would hit an object, it takes damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum 1). This happens regardless of how you Shoved the creature.
shortdesc: You can push larger foes around with your attack.

name: Quick Reversal
desc: You turn your foes' flanking against them with a quick reverse.
shortdesc: You turn your foes' flanking against them with a quick reverse.

name: Shielded Stride
desc: When your shield is up, your enemies' blows can't touch you. When you have your shield raised, you can Stride to move half your Speed without triggering reactions that are triggered by your movement (such as Attacks of Opportunity). You can use Shielded Stride while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.
hint: When you have your shield raised, you can Stride to move half your Speed without triggering reactions that are triggered by your movement (such as Attacks of Opportunity). You can use Shielded Stride while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.

name: Advantageous Assault
desc: When an enemy's movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow.
shortdesc: When an enemy's movement is compromised, you deliver a more deadly blow.

name: Disarming Stance
desc: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.
shortdesc: You adopt a fencing stance that improves your control over your weapon.

name: Furious Focus
desc: You've learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously. When you make a Power Attack with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.
hint: When you make a Power Attack with a melee weapon you're wielding in two hands, it counts as one attack toward your multiple attack penalty instead of two.
shortdesc: You've learned to maintain your balance even when swinging furiously.

name: Guardian's Deflection
desc: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally.
shortdesc: You use your weapon to deflect the attack against your ally.

name: Reflexive Shield
desc: You can use your shield to fend off the worst of area effects and other damage. When you Raise your Shield, you gain your shield's circumstance bonus to Reflex saves. If you have the Shield Block reaction, damage you take as a result of a Reflex save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.
hint: When you Raise your Shield, you gain your shield's circumstance bonus to Reflex saves. If you have the Shield Block reaction, damage you take as a result of a Reflex save can trigger that reaction, even if the damage isn't physical damage.
internalNote: The effect on Reflex saves is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can use your shield to fend off the worst of area effects and other damage.

name: Revealing Stab
desc: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.
shortdesc: You drive your piercing weapon into an imperceptible foe, revealing its location to your allies.

name: Shatter Defenses
desc: Your offense exploits your enemy's fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature.
shortdesc: Your offense exploits your enemy's fear. Make a melee Strike against a frightened creature.

name: Shield Warden (Fighter)
desc: You use your shield to protect your allies. When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.
hint: When you have a shield raised, you can use your Shield Block reaction when an attack is made against an ally adjacent to you. If you do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of preventing you from taking damage, following the normal rules for Shield Block.
shortdesc: You use your shield to protect your allies as well as yourself.

name: Triple Shot
desc: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control. When you use Double Shot, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to Double Shot to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is -4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made all of them.
hint: When you use Double Shot, you can make the attacks against the same target. You can add an additional action to Double Shot to make three ranged Strikes instead of two. If you do, the penalty is -4. All attacks count toward your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've made all of them.
shortdesc: You can quickly fire multiple shots with greater control.

name: Dueling Riposte
desc: You riposte against your flailing enemy.
shortdesc: You riposte against your flailing enemy.

Those with both the champion and fighter traits are both champion class feats and fighter class feats; when you take one of these feats, it loses the trait that doesn't apply to your class.

featreq: Attack of Opportunity or Attack of Opportunity (Fighter)

name: Incredible Aim
desc: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.
shortdesc: By spending a moment to focus, you can ensure your attack strikes true.

name: Mobile Shot Stance
desc: Your shots become nimble and deadly.
shortdesc: Your shots become nimble and deadly.

name: Positioning Assault

shortdesc: With punishing blows, you force your opponent into position.

name: Quick Shield Block
desc: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to Shield Block.
hint: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to Shield Block.
shortdesc: You can bring your shield into place with hardly a thought.

name: Sudden Leap
desc: You swing at a foe while mid-leap.
shortdesc: You swing at a foe while mid-leap.

name: Agile Grace
desc: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare. Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes -3 for your second attack and -6 for subsequent attacks (rather than -4 and -8).
hint: Your multiple attack penalty with agile weapons and agile unarmed attacks becomes -3 for your second attack and -6 for subsequent attacks (rather than -4 and -8).
shortdesc: Your graceful moves with agile weapons are beyond compare.

name: Certain Strike
desc: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.
shortdesc: Even when you don't hit squarely, you can still score a glancing blow.

name: Combat Reflexes
desc: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make an Attack of Opportunity.
hint: At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to make an Attack of Opportunity.
showon: Attacks, Attack of Opportunity, Attack of Opportunity (Fighter)
shortdesc: You are particularly swift at punishing foes who leave you openings.

name: Debilitating Shot
desc: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.
shortdesc: Aiming for a weak point, you impede your foe with a precise shot.

name: Disarming Twist
desc: After your initial attack redirects your foe's defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.
shortdesc: After your initial attack redirects your foe's defenses, your follow-up wrests their weapon from their grasp.

name: Disruptive Stance
desc: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions.
shortdesc: The slightest distraction can provoke your wrath, and you're prepared to foil enemies' actions.

name: Fearsome Brute
desc:
Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls for Strikes against frightened creatures. The bonus is equal to double the target's frightened value.

If you have master proficiency in Intimidation, increase the bonus to triple the target's frightened value.
hint:
You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls for Strikes against frightened creatures. The bonus is equal to double the target's frightened value.

If you have master proficiency in Intimidation, increase the bonus to triple the target's frightened value.
shortdesc: Fear makes your foes weak and more vulnerable to your attacks.

name: Improved Knockdown
desc: You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow. When you use Knockdown, instead of making a Strike followed by a Trip, you can attempt a single Strike. If you do and your Strike hits, you also apply the critical success effect of a Trip. If you used a two-handed melee weapon for the Strike, you can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical Trip.
hint: When you use Knockdown, instead of making a Strike followed by a Trip, you can attempt a single Strike. If you do and your Strike hits, you also apply the critical success effect of a Trip. If you used a two-handed melee weapon for the Strike, you can use the weapon's damage die size instead of the regular die size for the damage from a critical Trip.
shortdesc: You can dash your foe to the ground with a single blow.

name: Mirror Shield
desc: You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent.
shortdesc: You reflect the spell back against the triggering opponent.

name: Twin Riposte
desc: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon.
shortdesc: A clever parry with one weapon leaves your opponent open to an attack with the other weapon.

name: Brutal Finish
desc: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses.
shortdesc: Your final blow can make an impact even if it rebounds off a foe's defenses.

name: Dueling Dance
desc: Using your free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon.
shortdesc: Using your free hand as pivot and balance, you both attack and defend with your weapon.

name: Flinging Shove
desc: Increase the distance you Shove your opponent with Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you use Aggressive Block, you can choose whether the target is flat-footed or Shoved. When you make a Brutish Shove, you also Shove the target 5 feet on a failure.
hint: Increase the distance you Shove your opponent with Aggressive Block or Brutish Shove to 10 feet on a success or 20 feet on a critical success. When you use Aggressive Block, you can choose whether the target is flat-footed or Shoved. When you make a Brutish Shove, you also Shove the target 5 feet on a failure.
shortdesc: Your opponets go even farther when push them around.

name: Improved Dueling Riposte
desc: Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the opportunity presents itself. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a Dueling Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Dueling Parry.
hint: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to make a Dueling Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Dueling Parry.
shortdesc: Your weapon whirls and darts, striking foes whenever the opportunity presents itself.

name: Incredible Ricochet
desc: After your first shot singles out your opponent's position, you direct another that ricochets around obstacles and strikes unerringly.
shortdesc: After your first shot singles out your opponent's position, you direct another that ricochets around obstacles and strikes unerringly.

name: Lunging Stance
desc: Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies.
shortdesc: Your body coiled to strike, you can lash out at distant enemies.

name: Paragon's Guard
desc: Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.
shortdesc: Once you've had a moment to set your stance, you always have your shield ready without a thought.

name: Spring Attack
desc: Springing away from one foe, you Strike at another.
shortdesc: Springing away from one foe, you Strike at another.

name: Desperate Finisher
desc: You throw everything into one last press.
shortdesc: You throw everything into one last press.

name: Determination
desc: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire.
shortdesc: Your training allows you to shrug off your foes' spells and conditions when the need is dire.

name: Guiding Finish
desc: Using your weapon as a lever, you force your opponent to end up right where you want them.
shortdesc: Using your weapon as a lever, you force your opponent to end up right where you want them.

name: Guiding Riposte
desc: By shifting your weight and angling your weapon, you guide your opponent to a more favorable position. When you use Dueling Riposte to Strike and you hit, you can move the target up to 10 feet into a space in your reach. This follows the forced movement rules.
hint: When you use Dueling Riposte to Strike and you hit, you can move the target up to 10 feet into a space in your reach. This follows the forced movement rules.
shortdesc: By shifting your weight and angling your weapon, you guide your opponent to a more favorable position.

name: Improved Twin Riposte (Fighter)
desc: Your weapons are a blur, blocking and biting at your foes. At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.
hint: At the start of each of your turns, you gain an additional reaction that you can use only to perform a Twin Riposte. You can use this extra reaction even if you are not benefiting from Twin Parry.
shortdesc: Your weapons are a blur, blocking and biting at your foes.

name: Stance Savant (Fighter)
desc: When there's imminent danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought.
shortdesc: When there's imminent danger, you drop into a stance with a mere thought.

name: Two-Weapon Flurry
desc: You lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy.
shortdesc: You lash out with both your weapons in a sudden frenzy.

name: Whirlwind Strike
desc: You attack all nearby adversaries.
shortdesc: You attack all nearby adversaries.

name: Graceful Poise
desc: With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger.
shortdesc: With the right positioning, your off-hand weapon can strike like a scorpion's stinger.

name: Improved Reflexive Shield
desc: Your shield can help save nearby allies. When you use Shield Block against damage resulting from a Reflex save, adjacent allies who would take damage due to Reflex saves against the same effect also benefit from the damage reduction.
hint: When you use Shield Block against damage resulting from a Reflex save, adjacent allies who would take damage due to Reflex saves against the same effect also benefit from the damage reduction.
shortdesc: Your shield can help save nearby allies.

name: Multishot Stance
desc: You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately.
shortdesc: You lock yourself in a stable position so you can fire swiftly and accurately.

name: Twinned Defense
desc: You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you.
shortdesc: You're always ready to use your off-hand weapon to interfere with attacks against you.

name: Impossible Volley (Fighter)
desc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.
shortdesc: You fire a volley at all foes in an area.

name: Savage Critical
desc: The wounds you inflict are grievous. When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack for which you have legendary proficiency, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.
hint: When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack for which you have legendary proficiency, you critically succeed if you roll a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.
shortdesc: The wounds you inflict are grievous.

name: Boundless Reprisals
desc: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn.
hint: At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain a reaction you can use only during that turn.
shortdesc: With a sixth sense for the flow of combat, you can quickly react to any situation as required.

name: Ultimate Flexibility
desc: Your experience keeps you on your toes, allowing you to adapt to even the most dangerous challenges. When you gain a fighter feat using combat flexibility, you gain three fighter feats instead of one. The first feat must still be 8th level or lower, the second feat can be up to 14th level, and the third feat can be up to 18th level. You can use the first feat to meet the prerequisites of the second or third feats and the second feat to meet the prerequisites of the third feat. You must meet all feats' prerequisites. In addition, you can adapt to the battlefield's challenges by spending 1 hour to train. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with combat flexibility as if you had made your daily preparations.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
hint: You can adapt to the battlefield's challenges by spending 1 hour to train. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with combat flexibility as if you had made your daily preparations.
shortdesc: Gain more feats through combat flexibility.

name: Weapon Supremacy
desc: Your skill with weapons lets you attack swiftly at all times. You're permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Strike.
hint: You're permanently quickened. You can use your extra action only to Strike.
shortdesc: Your skill with weapons lets you attack swiftly at all times.

name: Fighter Dedication
desc: You become trained in simple weapons and martial weapons. You become trained in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in fighter class DC.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the fighter archetype.
shortdesc: You have spent time learning the art of warfare, increasing your skill with martial arms and at wearing armor.

name: Basic Maneuver
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level fighter feat.

name: Fighter Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting fighter archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each fighter archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier

name: Opportunist
desc: You gain the Attack of Opportunity reaction.
shortdesc: You gain the Attack of Opportunity reaction.

name: Advanced Maneuver
desc: You gain a fighter feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your fighter level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another fighter feat.
shortdesc: You gain a fighter feat.

name: Diverse Weapon Expert
desc: Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and martial weapons increase to expert, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to trained.
shortdesc: Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons and martial weapons increase to expert, and your proficiency rank for advanced weapons increases to trained.
specialreqdesc: expert in any kind of weapon or unarmed attack

name: Monk Dedication
desc: You become trained in unarmed attacks and gain the powerful fist class feature. You become trained in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in monk class DC.
specialdesc: You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the monk archetype.
shortdesc: Monastic training has taught you martial arts and allowed you to hone your mind, body, and spirit to new heights.

name: Basic Kata
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level monk feat.

name: Monk Resiliency
desc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have. As you continue selecting monk archetype class feats, you continue to gain additional Hit Points in this way.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each monk archetype class feat you have.
specialreqdesc: class granting no more Hit Points per level than 8 + your Constitution modifier

name: Advanced Kata
desc: You gain one monk feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your monk level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another monk feat.
shortdesc: You gain a monk feat.

name: Monk Moves
desc: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you're not wearing armor.
shortdesc: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed when you're not wearing armor.

name: Monk's Flurry
desc: You gain the Flurry of Blows action.
shortdesc: You gain the Flurry of Blows action.

name: Perfection's Path
desc: Choose one saving throw (Fortitude, Reflex, or Will) in which you are an expert. Your proficiency rank in the chosen saving throw increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in one saving throw increases to master.
specialreqdesc: expert in at least one saving throw

name: Perfection's Path: Fortitude
desc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saving throws increases to master.

name: Perfection's Path: Reflex
desc: Your proficiency rank in Reflex saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Reflex saving throws increases to master.

name: Perfection's Path: Will
desc: Your proficiency rank in Will saving throws increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank in Will saving throws increases to master.

name: Animal Companion (Ranger)
desc:
You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you on your adventures and obeys any simple commands you give it to the best of its abilities. See Animal Companions on page 214 for more information.

When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.
hint: When you Hunt Prey, your animal companion gains the action's benefits and your hunter's edge benefit if you have one.
shortdesc: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you.

name: Crossbow Ace
desc: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow. When you're wielding a crossbow and use Hunt Prey or use Interact to reload your crossbow, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the damage roll on your next Strike with that crossbow.
