desc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
shortdesc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

name: Ruffian Racket
desc:
You prefer to strong-arm or intimidate others rather than rely on finesse or fancy tricks. You might be an enforcer for organized crime, a highway bandit, or a noble who bullies others with threats of your family's power. Or, you might use your skills on the up and up, in a private security detail or as a guard in a city with the right temperament.

You use whatever tools you have at hand to get the job done. You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon, in addition to the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a simple weapon and the target has the flat-footed condition (unable to focus on defending itself), you also apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding (page 283). You don't gain these benefits if the weapon has a damage die larger than d8 (after applying any abilities that alter its damage die size).

You're trained in Intimidation and medium armor. You can choose Strength as your key ability score. When you gain light armor expertise, you also gain expert proficiency in medium armor, and when you gain light armor mastery, you also gain master proficiency in medium armor.
hint: You can deal sneak attack damage with any simple weapon, in addition to the weapons listed in the sneak attack class feature. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a simple weapon and the target has the flat-footed condition (unable to focus on defending itself), you also apply the critical specialization effect for the weapon you're wielding (page 283). You don't gain these benefits if the weapon has a damage die larger than d8 (after applying any abilities that alter its damage die size).
shortdesc: You prefer to strong-arm or intimidate others rather than rely on finesse or fancy tricks.

gainSpecialization.condition: against flat-footed creature, damage die up to d8

name: Scoundrel Racket
desc:
You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations. You might be a grifter or con artist, traveling from place to place with a new story or scheme. Your racket is also ideal for certain reputable professions, like barrister, diplomat, or politician.

When you successfully Feint, the target is flat-footed against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.

You're trained in Deception and Diplomacy. You can choose Charisma as your key ability score.
hint: When you successfully Feint, the target is flat-footed against melee attacks you attempt against it until the end of your next turn. On a critical success, the target is flat-footed against all melee attacks until the end of your next turn, not just yours.
shortdesc: You use fast-talking, flattery, and a silver tongue to avoid danger and escape tricky situations.

name: Thief Racket
desc:
Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else, especially if you can do so completely unnoticed. You might be a pickpocket working the streets, a cat burglar sneaking through windows and escaping via rooftops, or a safecracker breaking into carefully guarded vaults. You might even work as a consultant, testing clients' defenses by trying to steal something precious.

When a fight breaks out, you prefer swift, lightweight weapons, and you strike where it hurts. When you attack with a finesse melee weapon, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.

You are trained in Thievery.
hint: When you attack with a finesse melee weapon, you can add your Dexterity modifier to damage rolls instead of your Strength modifier.
shortdesc: Nothing beats the thrill of taking something that belongs to someone else, especially if you can do so completely unnoticed.

name: Nimble Dodge
desc: You deftly dodge out of the way.
shortdesc: You deftly dodge out of the way.

name: Trap Finder
desc:
You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't Searching, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.

You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in Thievery. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead, and your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.
hint:
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps, to AC against attacks made by traps, and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't Searching, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap.

You can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of master in Thievery. If you have master proficiency in Thievery, you can disable traps that require a proficiency rank of legendary instead, and your circumstance bonuses against traps increase to +2.
shortdesc: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps.

name: Twin Feint
desc: You make a dazzling series of attacks with both weapons, using the first attack to throw your foe of guard against a second attack at a different angle.
shortdesc: You make a dazzling series of attacks with both weapons, using the first attack to throw your foe of guard against a second attack at a different angle.

name: You're Next
desc: After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you're coming after them next.
shortdesc: After downing a foe, you menacingly remind another foe that you're coming after them next.

name: Brutal Beating
desc: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is frightened 1.
hint: Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is frightened 1.
shortdesc: The brutality of your critical hits shakes your foes' confidence.

name: Distracting Feint
desc: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal, drawing your foes' attention and allowing you and your allies to take greater advantage. While a creature is flat-footed by your Feint, it also takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and Reflex saves.
hint: While a creature is flat-footed by your Feint, it also takes a –2 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and Reflex saves.
shortdesc: Your Feints are far more distracting than normal, drawing your foes' attention and allowing you and your allies to take greater advantage.

name: Minor Magic
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities from a particular tradition. Choose arcane, divine, occult, or primal magic, and gain two cantrips from the common cantrips available to that tradition. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in spell attack rolls and DCs for the tradition of your chosen cantrips.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities from a particular tradition.

name: Minor Magic: Arcane
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common arcane cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in arcane spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common arcane cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Divine
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common divine cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in divine spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common divine cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Occult
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common occult cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in occult spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common occult cantrips.

name: Minor Magic: Primal
desc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining minor magical abilities. You gain two common primal cantrips. Your key spellcasting ability is Charisma, and you're trained in primal spell attack rolls and DCs.
shortdesc: You've dabbled in a variety of tricks, gaining two common primal cantrips.

name: Mobility
desc: You move in a way that denies your enemies the opportunity to retaliate. When you take a Stride action to move half your Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. You can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.
hint: When you take a Stride action to move half your Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions. You can use Mobility when Climbing, Flying, or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.
shortdesc: You move in a way that denies your enemies the opportunity to retaliate.

name: Quick Draw
desc: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion.
shortdesc: You draw your weapon and attack with the same motion.

name: Unbalancing Blow
desc: Interweaving your most powerful attacks in a graceful flow, you temporarily unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.
hint: Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.
shortdesc: Interweaving your most powerful attacks in a graceful flow, you temporarily unbalance your foes. Whenever your Strike is a critical hit and deals damage, the target is flat-footed against your attacks until the end of your next turn.

name: Battle Assessment
desc: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy's strengths and weaknesses.
shortdesc: With careful observation during battle, you identify an enemy's strengths and weaknesses.

name: Dread Striker
desc: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses. Any creature that has the frightened condition is also flat-footed against your attacks.
hint: Any creature that has the frightened condition is also flat-footed against your attacks.
shortdesc: You capitalize on your enemies' fear to slip past their defenses.

name: Magical Trickster
desc: Whether you're using magic items, wielding innate magic, or dabbling in spellcasting, you can sneak spells past your foes' defenses as easily as any blade. When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a flat-footed foe's AC and the spell deals damage, you can add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. If your single spell leads to multiple separate damage rolls, apply your sneak attack damage only once per target.
hint: When you succeed at a spell attack roll against a flat-footed foe's AC and the spell deals damage, you can add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. If your single spell leads to multiple separate damage rolls, apply your sneak attack damage only once per target.
shortdesc: You can sneak spells past your foes' defenses as easily as any blade.

name: Poison Weapon
desc: You apply poison to a weapon.
specialdesc: During your daily preparations, you can prepare a number of simple injury poisons equal to your rogue level. These poisons deal 1d4 poison damage. Only you can apply these poisons properly, and they expire the next time you prepare.
shortdesc: You apply poison to a weapon.

name: Reactive Pursuit
desc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.
shortdesc: You keep pace with a retreating foe.

name: Sabotage
desc: You subtly damage others' equipment.
shortdesc: You subtly damage others' equipment.

name: Scout's Warning
desc: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger.
shortdesc: You visually or audibly warn your allies of danger.

name: Gang Up
desc: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert. Any enemy is flat-footed against your melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within both your reach and your ally's. Your allies must still flank an enemy for it to be flat-footed to them.
hint: Any enemy is flat-footed against your melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within both your reach and your ally's. Your allies must still flank an enemy for it to be flat-footed to them.
shortdesc: You and your allies harry an opponent in concert.

name: Light Step
desc: You aren't bothered by tricky footing. When you Stride or Step, you can ignore difficult terrain.
hint: When you Stride or Step, you can ignore difficult terrain.
shortdesc: You aren't bothered by tricky footing.

name: Skirmish Strike
desc: Your feet and weapon move in tandem.
shortdesc: Your feet and weapon move in tandem.

name: Twist the Knife
desc: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.
shortdesc: After stabbing your opponent in a weak spot, you tear the wound open.

name: Blind-Fight
desc:
Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents. You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You're not flat-footed to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're flat-footed to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

While you're adjacent to an undetected creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you.
hint:
You don't need to succeed at a flat check to target concealed creatures. You're not flat-footed to creatures that are hidden from you (unless you're flat-footed to them for reasons other than the hidden condition), and you need only a successful DC 5 flat check to target a hidden creature.

While you're adjacent to an undetected creature of your level or lower, it is instead only hidden from you.
shortdesc: Your battle instincts make you more aware of concealed and invisible opponents.

name: Delay Trap
desc: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.
shortdesc: You can jam the workings of a trap to delay its effects.

name: Improved Poison Weapon
desc: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects. When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 2d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.
hint: When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 2d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. You don't waste a poison you apply with Poison Weapon on a critically failed attack roll.
shortdesc: You deliver poisons in ways that maximize their harmful effects.

name: Nimble Roll
desc:
You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger. You can use Nimble Dodge before attempting a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use Nimble Dodge and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or when you succeed or critically succeed at the saving throw, you can also Stride up to 10 feet as part of the reaction. If you do, the reaction gains the move trait. You can use Nimble Roll while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.
hint:
You can use Nimble Dodge before attempting a Reflex save in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

When you use Nimble Dodge and the triggering attack fails or critically fails, or when you succeed or critically succeed at the saving throw, you can also Stride up to 10 feet as part of the reaction. If you do, the reaction gains the move trait. You can use Nimble Roll while Flying or Swimming instead of Striding if you have the corresponding movement type.
shortdesc: You throw yourself into a roll to escape imminent danger.

name: Opportune Backstab
desc: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.
shortdesc: When your enemy is hit by your ally, you capitalize upon the distraction.

name: Sidestep
desc: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you.
shortdesc: You deftly step out of the way of an attack, letting the blow continue to the creature next to you.

name: Sly Striker
desc: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren't flat-footed. When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike against a creature that isn't flat-footed, you also deal 1d6 precision damage. This applies only if you're using a weapon or unarmed attack you could deal sneak attack damage with. At 14th level, if you would normally deal 3d6 or more sneak attack damage to flat-footed creatures, you deal 2d6 precision damage to creatures that aren't flat-footed.
hint: When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike against a creature that isn't flat-footed, you also deal 1d6 precision damage. This applies only if you're using a weapon or unarmed attack you could deal sneak attack damage with. At 14th level, if you would normally deal 3d6 or more sneak attack damage to flat-footed creatures, you deal 2d6 precision damage to creatures that aren't flat-footed.
shortdesc: Your attacks deal more damage, even against creatures that aren't flat-footed.

name: Precise Debilitation
desc: You carefully aim and gracefully deliver your debilitations. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from your attacks. Debilitation The target becomes flat-footed.
hint:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation The target takes an additional 2d6 precision damage from your attacks.
Debilitation The target becomes flat-footed.
shortdesc: You carefully aim and gracefully deliver your debilitations.

name: Sneak Savant
desc: It is almost impossible to spot you without taking effort to look. When you roll a failure on a Sneak action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.
hint: When you roll a failure on a Sneak action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.
shortdesc: It is almost impossible to spot you without taking effort to look.

name: Tactical Debilitations
desc: You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target can't use reactions. Debilitation The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.
hint:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation The target can't use reactions.
Debilitation The target can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking.
shortdesc: You learn new debilitations that grant you tactical advantages against your foes.

name: Vicious Debilitations
desc: The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes. Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike. Debilitation The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Debilitation The target becomes clumsy 1.
hint:
Add the following debilitations to the list you can choose from when you use Debilitating Strike.

Debilitation The target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.
Debilitation The target becomes clumsy 1.
shortdesc: The debilitations you dish out seriously impair your foes.

name: Critical Debilitations
desc: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks. Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use Debilitating Strike, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from. Debilitation The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target is slowed 1 until the end of your next turn. Failure The target is slowed 2 until the end of your next turn. Critical Failure The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.
hint:
Whenever you critically succeed at an attack roll against an enemy and use Debilitating Strike, add the following debilitation to the list you can choose from.

Debilitation The target attempts a Fortitude save against your class DC with the following effects.
Critical Success The target is unaffected.
Success The target is slowed 1 until the end of your next turn.
Failure The target is slowed 2 until the end of your next turn.
Critical Failure The target is paralyzed until the end of your next turn.
shortdesc: Your debilitations are especially effective on your most powerful attacks.

name: Deadly Poison Weapon
desc: Your poisons are devastatingly potent. When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an injury poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.
hint: When you apply a simple poison with Poison Weapon, the poison deals 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an injury poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.
shortdesc: Your poisons are devastatingly potent.

name: Fantastic Leap
desc: You launch yourself through the air at a foe.
shortdesc: You launch yourself through the air at a foe.

name: Felling Shot
desc: Your ranged attacks can shoot an unprepared foe right out of the air.
shortdesc: Your ranged attacks can shoot an unprepared foe right out of the air.

name: Reactive Interference
desc: You reflexively foil an enemy's response.
shortdesc: You reflexively foil an enemy's response.

name: Spring from the Shadows
desc: Leaping out from hiding, you assail your target when they least expect it.
shortdesc: Leaping out from hiding, you assail your target when they least expect it.

name: Defensive Roll
desc: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious.
shortdesc: Dropping into a roll to disperse the force of the blow, you can partially evade a lethal attack and stay conscious.

name: Instant Opening
desc: You distract your opponent with a few choice words or a rude gesture.
shortdesc: You distract your opponent with a few choice words or a rude gesture.

name: Leave an Opening
desc: When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action. Whenever you critically hit a flat-footed opponent with a melee attack and deal damage, the target triggers an Attack of Opportunity reaction from one ally of your choice who has that reaction, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.
hint: Whenever you critically hit a flat-footed opponent with a melee attack and deal damage, the target triggers an Attack of Opportunity reaction from one ally of your choice who has that reaction, as if the enemy had used a manipulate action.
shortdesc: When you hit hard enough, you leave an opening so your ally can jump in on the action.

name: Sense the Unseen
desc: When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues.
shortdesc: When you look for foes, you can catch even the slightest cues.

name: Blank Slate
desc: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations. Detection, revelation, and scrying effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract level of 20 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.
hint: Detection, revelation, and scrying effects pass right over you, your possessions, and your auras, detecting nothing unless the detecting effect has a counteract level of 20 or higher. For example, detect magic would still detect other magic in the area but not any magic on you, true seeing wouldn't reveal you, locate or scrying wouldn't find you, and so on.
shortdesc: Your deceptions confound even the most powerful mortal divinations.

name: Cloud Step
desc: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces. When you Stride, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you Stride over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.
hint: When you Stride, you can move across water, air, and solid surfaces that can hold only limited weight as if they were normal ground. If you Stride over a trap with a weight-sensitive pressure plate, you don't trigger it. At the end of your turn, you sink, fall, break fragile surfaces, or trigger traps as normal for your current location.
shortdesc: Using fantastic acrobatic skill, you can walk for brief stretches across insubstantial surfaces.

name: Cognitive Loophole
desc: You can find a loophole in a mental effect to temporarily overcome it.
shortdesc: You can find a loophole in a mental effect to temporarily overcome it.

name: Dispelling Slice
desc: Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target.
shortdesc: Your sneak attack slices through the threads binding magic to a target.

name: Perfect Distraction
desc: You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away. You Sneak while leaving a decoy behind.
shortdesc: You use clever tactics to mislead your foes as you sneak away. You Sneak while leaving a decoy behind.

name: Implausible Infiltration
desc: You find tiny holes or imperfections that no one else could see and try to somehow fit yourself through them.
shortdesc: You find tiny holes or imperfections that no one else could see and try to somehow fit yourself through them.

name: Powerful Sneak
desc: You have learned to exploit your enemies' lowered defenses. When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike using your Strength modifier on the attack roll and you would deal sneak attack damage, you can change the additional damage from sneak attack into ordinary damage of the same type as your Strike, rather than precision damage.
hint: When you succeed or critically succeed at a Strike using your Strength modifier on the attack roll and you would deal sneak attack damage, you can change the additional damage from sneak attack into ordinary damage of the same type as your Strike, rather than precision damage.
shortdesc: You have learned to exploit your enemies' lowered defenses.

name: Trickster's Ace
desc: You have a contingency in your back pocket for desperate situations.
shortdesc: You have a contingency in your back pocket for desperate situations.

name: Enduring Debilitation
desc: Your debilitations last for 1 minute.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
shortdesc: Your debilitations last for 1 minute.

name: Hidden Paragon
desc: When you put your mind to slipping out of sight, you disappear completely.
shortdesc: When you put your mind to slipping out of sight, you disappear completely.

name: Impossible Striker
desc: Your attacks are swift and deadly beyond explanation. Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming. Instead of dealing the damage from Sly Striker, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't flat-footed.
hint: Nothing can prevent you from making a sneak attack, even if your opponent can see every blow coming. Instead of dealing the damage from Sly Striker, you can deal your full sneak attack damage to a target even if the target isn't flat-footed.
shortdesc: Your attacks are swift and deadly beyond explanation.

name: Reactive Distraction
desc: You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe.
shortdesc: You reactively switch with your decoy to foil your foe.

name: Rogue Dedication
desc: You gain a skill feat and the rogue's surprise attack class feature. You become trained in light armor. In addition, you become trained in Stealth or Thievery plus one skill of your choice; if you are already trained in both Stealth and Thievery, you become trained in an additional skill of your choice. You become trained in rogue class DC.
specialdesc: You cannot gain another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the rogue archetype.
shortdesc: You've learned to sneak, steal, and disable traps. With time and luck, you'll become capable of moving through the shadows, striking unseen, and escaping without notice.

name: Basic Trickery
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level rogue feat.

name: Sneak Attacker
desc: You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 damage, increasing to 1d6 at 6th level. You don't increase the number of dice as you gain levels.
hint: If you Strike a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage. Increase the damage to 1d6 at 6th level. For a ranged attack with a thrown melee weapon, that weapon must also be agile or finesse.
shortdesc: You gain the sneak attack class feature, except it deals 1d4 damage.

name: Advanced Trickery
desc: You gain one rogue feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your rogue level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another rogue feat.
shortdesc: You gain one rogue feat.

name: Skill Mastery
desc: Increase your proficiency rank in one of your skills from expert to master and in another of your skills from trained to expert. You gain a skill feat associated with one of the skills you chose.
specialdesc: You can select this feat up to five times.
shortdesc: You gain 3 additional Hit Points for each ranger archetype class feat you have.
specialreq: ((characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) == 2) && characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) == 4))) || (this.have(character, characterService, charLevel) && (characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) >= 2) && characterService.get_Skills(character, '', 'Skill').find(skill => Skill_Level('Character', skill.name) >= 4)))
specialreqdesc: trained in at least one skill and expert in at least one skill

name: Uncanny Dodge
desc: You gain the deny advantage class feature.
shortdesc: You gain the deny advantage class feature.

name: Evasiveness
desc: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.
shortdesc: Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master.

name: Enigma Muse
desc: Your muse is a mystery, driving you to uncover the hidden secrets of the multiverse. If your muse is a creature, it might be a dragon or otherworldly being; if a deity, it might be Irori or Nethys. You gain the Bardic Lore feat and add true strike to your spell repertoire.
inputRequired: Add True Strike to your repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a mystery, driving you to uncover the hidden secrets of the multiverse.

name: Maestro Muse
desc: Your muse is a virtuoso, inspiring you to greater heights. If it's a creature, it might be a performance-loving creature such as a choral angel or lillend azata; if a deity, it might be Shelyn. As a bard with a Maestro Muse, you are an inspiration to your allies and confident of your musical and oratorical abilities. You gain the Lingering Composition feat and add soothe to your spell repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a virtuoso, inspiring you to greater heights.

name: Polymath Muse
desc: Your muse is a jack of all trades, flitting between skills and pursuits. If it's is a creature, it might be an eclectic creature like a fey; if a deity, it might be Desna or Calistria. As a bard with a polymath muse, you are interested in a wide array of topics but rarely dedicated to any one, and you rarely make up your mind—you want to try everything. You gain the Versatile Performance feat and add unseen servant to your spell repertoire.
inputRequired: Add Unseen Servant to your repertoire.
shortdesc: Your muse is a jack of all trades, flitting between skills and pursuits.

name: Bardic Lore
desc: Your studies make you informed on every subject. You are trained in Bardic Lore, a special Lore skill that can be used only to Recall Knowledge, but on any topic. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you gain expert proficiency in Bardic Lore, but you can't increase your proficiency rank in Bardic Lore by any other means.
hint: Bardic Lore can be used only to Recall Knowledge, but on any topic.
internalNote: The increase from Occultism and the inability to increase the skill is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your studies make you informed on every subject.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: Lingering Composition
desc: By adding a flourish, you make your compositions last longer. You learn the lingering composition focus spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: By adding a flourish, you make your compositions last longer.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Versatile Performance
desc: You can rely on the grandeur of your performances rather than ordinary social skills. You can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to Make an Impression and instead of Intimidation to Demoralize. You can also use an acting Performance instead of Deception to Impersonate. You can use your proficiency rank in Performance to meet the requirements of skill feats that require a particular rank in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation.
hint: You can use Performance instead of Diplomacy to Make an Impression and instead of Intimidation to Demoralize. You can also use an acting Performance instead of Deception to Impersonate.
internalNote: Using Performance for skill requirements is hardcoded.
shortdesc: You can rely on the grandeur of your performances rather than ordinary social skills.
featreq: Polymath Muse or Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse

name: Cantrip Expansion (Spontaneous)
desc: A greater understanding of your magic broadens your range of simple spells. Add two additional cantrips from your spell list to your repertoire.
shortdesc: Study broadens your range of simple spells.

name: Esoteric Polymath
desc:
You keep a book of occult spells, similar to a wizard's spellbook, and can use its spells to supplement your spell repertoire. Add all the spells in your repertoire to this book for free. You can use the Occultism skill to Learn Spells (page 238) and add them to your spellbook by paying the appropriate cost, similar to a wizard.

During your daily preparations, choose any one spell from your book of occult spells. If that spell is already in your spell repertoire, you can treat it as an additional signature spell that day. If it isn't in your repertoire, treat it as though it were until your next daily preparations.
internalNote: The mechanism is hardcoded to decide whether the spell is a signature spell.
shortdesc: You keep a book of occult spells, similar to a wizard's spellbook.
featreq: Polymath Muse or Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse

name: Inspire Competence
desc: You learn the inspire competence composition cantrip, which aids your allies' skills.
shortdesc: You learn the inspire competence composition cantrip, which aids your allies' skills.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Loremaster's Etude
desc: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall. You learn the loremaster's etude composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You magically unlock memories, making them easier to recall.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: Multifarious Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. Choose a type of muse other than that of your own. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires that muse, and your muse is now also a muse of that type, allowing you to take feats with the other muse as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the muse you chose.
specialdesc: You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must choose a different type of muse other than that of your own.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.

name: Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the enigma muse, and your muse is now also an enigma muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the enigma muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.

name: Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the maestro muse, and your muse is now also a maestro muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the maestro muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.

name: Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse
desc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label. You gain a 1st-level feat that requires the polymath muse, and your muse is now also a polymath muse, allowing you to take feats with it as a prerequisite. You don't gain any of the other effects of the polymath muse.
shortdesc: Your muse doesn't fall into a single label.

name: Inspire Defense
desc: You learn the inspire defense composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.
shortdesc: You learn the inspire defense composition cantrip, which protects you and allies.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Melodious Spell
desc: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance.
shortdesc: You subtly weave your spellcasting into your performance.

name: Triple Time
desc: You learn the triple time composition cantrip, which speeds up you and your allies for a round.
shortdesc: You learn to speed up yourself and your allies with your performance.

name: Versatile Signature
desc: While most bards are known for certain signature performances and spells, you're always tweaking your available repertoire. When you make your daily preparations, you can change one of your signature spells to a different spell of that level from your repertoire.
hint: When you make your daily preparations, you can change one of your signature spells to a different spell of that level from your repertoire.
inputRequired: To perform this change, you can exchange spells between your signature spell slot and another spell slot of the same level.
internalNote: There is no mechanical difference. This feat gives you official permission to change your spells every day.
shortdesc: You're always tweaking your available repertoire.
featreq: Polymath Muse or Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse

name: Dirge of Doom
desc: You learn the dirge of doom composition cantrip, which frightens your enemies.
shortdesc: You learn to frighten your enemies with your performance.

name: Harmonize
desc: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously.
shortdesc: You can perform multiple compositions simultaneously.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Eclectic Skill
desc: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills. Your proficiency bonus to untrained skill checks is equal to your level. You can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to be trained, even if you are untrained. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to have expert proficiency, even if untrained or trained.
hint: You can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to be trained, even if you are untrained. If you have legendary proficiency in Occultism, you can attempt any skill check that normally requires you to have expert proficiency, even if untrained or trained.
shortdesc: Your broad experiences translate to a range of skills.
featreq: Polymath Muse or Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse

name: Inspire Heroics
desc: Your performances inspire even greater deeds in your allies. You learn the inspire heroics metamagic focus spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: Your performances inspire even greater deeds in your allies.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Know-It-All
desc: When you succeed at a Knowledge check, you gain additional information or context. When you critically succeed at a Knowledge check, at the GM's discretion you might gain even more additional information or context than normal.
hint: When you critically succeed at a Knowledge check, at the GM's discretion you might gain even more additional information or context than normal.
showon: Arcana, Crafting, Lore, Medicine, Nature, Occultism, Religion, Society
shortdesc: Your knowledge of the world expands beyond what you have read.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: House of Imaginary Walls
desc: You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real. You learn the house of imaginary walls composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You erect an imaginary barrier others believe to be real.

name: Unusual Composition
desc: You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums.
shortdesc: You can translate the emotion and power of a composition to other mediums.
featreq: Polymath Muse or Multifarious Muse: Polymath Muse

name: Eclectic Polymath
desc: Your flexible mind can quickly shift spells. If you add a spell to your repertoire during your daily preparations using Esoteric Polymath, when you prepare again, you can choose to keep the new spell from Esoteric Polymath in your repertoire and instead lose access to another spell of the same level in your repertoire.
hint: If you add a spell to your repertoire during your daily preparations using Esoteric Polymath, when you prepare again, you can choose to keep the new spell from Esoteric Polymath in your repertoire and instead lose access to another spell of the same level in your repertoire.
inputRequired: To perform this change, you can change a spell slot in your repertoire to the spell you chose with Esoteric Polymath.
internalNote: There is no mechanical difference. This feat gives you official permission to change your spells every day.
shortdesc: Your flexible mind can quickly shift spells.

name: Inspirational Focus
desc: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus. If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.
hint: If you have spent at least 2 Focus Points since the last time you Refocused, you recover 2 Focus Points when you Refocus instead of 1.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your connection to your muse has granted you unusual focus.

name: Silver's Refrain
desc: You learn the silver's refrain composition cantrip, which aids you when fighting devils.
shortdesc: Learn the silver's refrain composition cantrip.

name: Allegro
desc: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance. You learn the allegro composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You can quicken your allies with a fast-paced performance.

name: Soothing Ballad
desc: You soothe your allies' wounds with the power of your performance. You learn the soothing ballad composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: You soothe your allies' wounds with the power of your performance.

name: True Hypercognition
desc: Your mind works at an incredible pace.
shortdesc: Your mind works at an incredible pace.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: Studious Capacity
desc: Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity, allowing you to cast spells even when it seems impossible. You can cast one spell each day even after you've run out of spell slots of the appropriate spell level, but you can't use this ability to cast a spell of your highest spell level.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your continued study of occult magic has increased your magical capacity.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: Deep Lore
desc: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual. Add one spell to your repertoire of each level you can cast.
shortdesc: Your repertoire is vast, containing far more spells than usual.
featreq: Enigma Muse or Multifarious Muse: Enigma Muse

name: Eternal Composition
desc: The world is a stage upon which you are always playing. You are permanently quickened; you can use your extra action only to cast a composition cantrip that requires 1 action to cast. While in exploration mode, you can declare that you are performing an eligible composition cantrip while using any exploration tactic. Even before your first turn in a combat encounter, that cantrip is active as if you had cast it on your previous turn.
hint: You are permanently quickened; you can use your extra action only to cast a composition cantrip that requires 1 action to cast. While in exploration mode, you can declare that you are performing an eligible composition cantrip while using any exploration tactic. Even before your first turn in a combat encounter, that cantrip is active as if you had cast it on your previous turn.
shortdesc: The world is a stage upon which you are always playing.
featreq: Maestro Muse or Multifarious Muse: Maestro Muse

name: Impossible Polymath
desc:
Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions that other bards don't understand. As long as you're trained in Arcana, you can add arcane spells to your book from Esoteric Polymath; as long as you're trained in Nature, you can add primal spells to your book; and as long as you are trained in Religion, you can add divine spells to your book.

Like your other spells in your book, you can add one of these spells from another tradition to your repertoire as an occult spell each day using Esoteric Polymath, but you can't retain any spells from another tradition when you prepare again, even if you have Eclectic Polymath.
hint:
As long as you're trained in Arcana, you can add arcane spells to your book from Esoteric Polymath; as long as you're trained in Nature, you can add primal spells to your book; and as long as you are trained in Religion, you can add divine spells to your book.

Like your other spells in your book, you can add one of these spells from another tradition to your repertoire as an occult spell each day using Esoteric Polymath, but you can't retain any spells from another tradition when you prepare again, even if you have Eclectic Polymath.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Your esoteric formulas are so unusual that they allow you to dabble in magic from diverse traditions.

name: Fatal Aria
desc: Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion, potentially striking them dead on the spot. You learn the fatal aria composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
shortdesc: Your songs overwhelm the target with unbearable emotion.

name: Perfect Encore
desc: You develop another incredible creation. You gain an additional 10th-level spell slot.
shortdesc: You develop another incredible creation.

name: Ringmaster's Introduction
desc: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.
shortdesc: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.

name: Song of the Fallen
desc: The moving power of your songs can stir the spirits of the dead to rise once more and fight alongside you. You learn the song of the fallen composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
specialdesc: The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion - ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor's Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise's trainers and records unlock this uncommon class feat.
shortdesc: Gain the song of the fallen focus spell.

name: Symphony of the Muses
desc: You are able to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony. You are no longer limited to a single composition each turn or a single composition at a time; when you use a new composition, all previous compositions' effects continue for their remaining duration.
hint: You are no longer limited to a single composition each turn or a single composition at a time; when you use a new composition, all previous compositions' effects continue for their remaining duration.
shortdesc: You are able to weave countless performances together into a solo symphony.

name: Bard Dedication
desc:
You cast spells like a bard and gain the Cast a Spell activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the occult spell list, or any other cantrips you learn or discover. You can add to your repertoire common cantrips of your spellcasting tradition, whether from this book or other cantrips of that tradition you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for occult spells. Your key spellcasting ability for bard archetype spells is Charisma, and they are occult bard spells. You become trained in Occultism and Performance; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

Choose a muse as you would if you were a bard. You have that muse for all purposes, allowing you to take that muse's feats, but you don't gain any of the other abilities it grants.
specialdesc: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the bard archetype.
shortdesc: A muse has called you to dabble in occult lore, allowing you to cast a few spells. The deeper you delve, the more powerful your performances become.

name: Basic Bard Spellcasting
desc: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the bard archetype, add a common occult spell or another spell you learned or discovered to your repertoire, of the appropriate spell level.
shortdesc: You gain the basic spellcasting benefits.

name: Basic Muse's Whispers
desc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.
shortdesc: You gain a 1st- or 2nd-level bard feat.

name: Advanced Muse's Whispers
desc: You gain one bard feat. For the purpose of meeting its prerequisites, your bard level is equal to half your character level.
specialdesc: Special You can select this feat more than once. Each time you select it, you gain another bard feat.
shortdesc: You gain one wizard feat.

name: Counter Perform
desc: You gain the counter performance composition spell. If you don't already have one, you gain a focus pool of 1 Focus Point, which you can Refocus by engaging your muse.
shortdesc: You gain the counter performance composition spell.

name: Inspirational Performance
desc: You gain the inspire courage composition cantrip.
shortdesc: You gain the inspire courage composition cantrip.

name: Occult Breadth
desc: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day. Increase the number of spells in your repertoire and the number of spell slots you gain from bard archetype feats by 1 for each spell level other than your two highest spell levels.
internalNote: The effect is hardcoded in the spellchoice component.
shortdesc: Your repertoire expands, and you can cast more occult spells each day.

name: Expert Bard Spellcasting
desc: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.
shortdesc: You gain the expert spellcasting benefits.

name: Master Bard Spellcasting
desc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.
shortdesc: You gain the master spellcasting benefits.

name: Bouncy Goblin
desc: You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Acrobatics (or another skill of your choice, if you were already trained in Acrobatics). You also gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Tumble Through a foe's space.
hint: You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Acrobatics checks to Tumble Through a foe's space.
shortdesc: You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish.

name: Burn It!
desc: Fire fascinates you. Your spells and alchemical items that deal fire damage gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level or one-quarter the item's level (minimum 1). You also gain a +1 status bonus to any persistent fire damage you deal.
hint: Your spells and alchemical items that deal fire damage gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level or one-quarter the item's level (minimum 1). You also gain a +1 status bonus to any persistent fire damage you deal.
shortdesc: Fire fascinates you.

name: City Scavenger
desc:
You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Subsist, and you can use Society or Survival when you Subsist in a settlement.

When you Subsist in a city, you also gather valuable junk that silly longshanks threw away. You can Earn Income using Society or Survival in the same time as you Subsist, without spending any additional days of downtime. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check.
hint:
You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to Subsist, and you can use Society or Survival when you Subsist in a settlement.

You can Earn Income using Society or Survival in the same time as you Subsist, without spending any additional days of downtime. You also gain a +1 circumstance bonus to this check.

If you have the irongut goblin heritage, increase both bonuses to +2.
shortdesc: You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps.

name: Fang Sharpener
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. If you're an irongut goblin, you gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage, and if you're a razortooth goblin, your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Fang Sharpener: Irongut Goblin
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. You gain a jaws unarmed attack that deals 1d4 piercing damage. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Fang Sharpener: Razortooth Goblin
desc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon. Your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
hint: Your jaws unarmed attack deals 1d8 piercing damage and loses the finesse trait. Whenever you score a critical hit with your jaws unarmed attack, your target takes 1 persistent bleed damage per weapon damage die.
internalNote: Losing the finesse trait is hardcoded in the Weapon class.
shortdesc: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

name: Goblin Lore
desc: You've picked up skills and tales from your goblin community. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Nature and Stealth. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in Goblin Lore.
shortdesc: You've picked up skills and tales from your goblin community.

name: Goblin Scuttle
desc: You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position.
shortdesc: You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position.

name: Goblin Song
desc: You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.
shortdesc: You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.

name: Goblin Weapon Familiarity
desc:
Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp. You are trained with the dogslicer and horsechopper.

In addition, you gain access to all uncommon goblin weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial goblin weapons are simple weapons and advanced goblin weapons are martial weapons.
hint: You gain access to all uncommon goblin weapons. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial goblin weapons are simple weapons and advanced goblin weapons are martial weapons.
shortdesc: Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp.

name: Hard Tail
desc: Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip. You gain a tail unarmed attack that deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
shortdesc: Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip.

name: Junk Tinker
desc:
You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps. When using the Crafting skill to Craft, you can make level 0 items, including weapons but not armor, out of junk. This reduces the Price to one-quarter the usual amount but always results in a shoddy item. Shoddy items normally give a penalty, but you don't take this penalty when using shoddy items you made.

You can also incorporate junk to save money while you Craft any item. This grants you a discount on the item as if you had spent 1 additional day working to reduce the cost, but the item is obviously made of junk. At the GM's discretion, this might affect the item's resale value depending on the buyer's tastes.
hint:
When using the Crafting skill to Craft, you can make level 0 items, including weapons but not armor, out of junk. This reduces the Price to one-quarter the usual amount but always results in a shoddy item. Shoddy items normally give a penalty, but you don't take this penalty when using shoddy items you made.

You can also incorporate junk to save money while you Craft any item. This grants you a discount on the item as if you had spent 1 additional day working to reduce the cost, but the item is obviously made of junk. At the GM's discretion, this might affect the item's resale value depending on the buyer's tastes.
inputRequired: Ignoring the shoddy status is hardcoded in the Weapon, Armor and Shield classes.
shortdesc: You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps.

name: Rough Rider
desc: You are especially good at riding traditional goblin mounts. You gain the Ride feat, even if you don't meet the prerequisites. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to use Command an Animal on a goblin dog or wolf mount. You can always select a wolf as your animal companion, even if you would usually select an animal companion with the mount special ability, such as for a champion's steed ally.
hint: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to use Command an Animal on a goblin dog or wolf mount.
shortdesc: You are especially good at riding traditional goblin mounts.

name: Very Sneaky
desc: Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this. You can move 5 feet farther when you take the Sneak action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use Sneak actions and succeed at your Stealth check, you don't become observed if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't concealed at the end of the Sneak action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are concealed at the end of your turn.
hint: You can move 5 feet farther when you take the Sneak action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use Sneak actions and succeed at your Stealth check, you don't become observed if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't concealed at the end of the Sneak action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are concealed at the end of your turn.
shortdesc: Taller folk rarely pay attention to the shadows at their feet, and you take full advantage of this.

name: Ankle Bite
desc: Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.
shortdesc: Whenever someone grabs onto you, you instinctively bite down hard.
specialreq: character.class.heritage.name == 'Razortooth Goblin' || Has_Feat('Character', 'Fang Sharpener: Irongut Goblin')
specialreqdesc: Fang Sharpener or razortooth goblin heritage

name: Chosen of Lamashtu
desc: You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters. She has bestowed a mutation upon you, granting you the benefits of another heritage. Choose one goblin heritage that you do not already have; you gain that heritage and its benefits.
shortdesc: You bear the favor and blessings of Lamashtu, the Mother of Monsters.

name: Fey Influence
desc: You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait and one of the following features which grant an innate primal spell that can be used once per day. Anteater You can launch your tongue forward as a deadly attack, gaining grim tendrils. Dryad Your body is covered in elegant vines, granting you summon plants and fungi. Gremlin You have long, bat-like ears and gain bane. Monarch You have vestigial, insectile features and gain spider sting. This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Anteater
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait and gain grim tendrils as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day by launching your tongue forward as a deadly attack.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Dryad
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and your body is covered in elegant vines, granting you summon plants and fungi as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Gremlin
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and you have long, bat-like ears, granting you bane as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Fey Influence: Monarch
desc:
You have been exposed to powerful fey magic. You become trained in primal DCs and spell attack rolls. You gain the fey trait, and you have vestigial, insectile features, granting you spider sting as an innate primal spell that can be used once per day.

This feat gains the trait appropriate for your ancestry (human for human, goblin for goblin, etc.)
shortdesc: Your exposure to fey influence has given you some primal magic
sourceBook: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-17: The Perennial Crown Part 2, The Thorned Monarch

name: Goblin Weapon Frenzy
desc: You know how to wield your people's vicious weapons. Whenever you score a critical hit using a goblin weapon, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.
shortdesc: You know how to wield your people's vicious weapons.

name: Tail Spin
desc: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.
shortdesc: You excel at using your tail as a weapon to upend your foes.

name: Torch Goblin
desc: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.
shortdesc: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage.

name: Tree Climber (Goblin)
desc: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet. If you also have the Cave Climber ancestry feat, your total climb Speed increases to your land Speed when climbing trees.
hint: If you have the Cave Climber ancestry feat, your total climb Speed increases to your land Speed when climbing trees.
shortdesc: Your time in forest or jungle canopies has taught you how to scramble across branches with sure feet.

name: Cave Climber
desc: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go. You gain a climb Speed of 10 feet.
shortdesc: After years of crawling and climbing through caverns, you can climb easily anywhere you go.

name: Freeze It!
desc: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.
shortdesc: You are no rime hag or Jadwiga, but the magic of the north has still left a mark on you.

name: Hungry Goblin
desc: You'll eat anything and anyone. Whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with your jaws unarmed attack, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute.
hint: Whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with your jaws unarmed attack, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level for 1 minute. You can activate this effect in your activities.
shortdesc: You'll eat anything and anyone.

name: Roll with It
desc: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.
shortdesc: When you take a big hit, your foe bounces you around like a rubber ball, but you escape the worst of the blow.

name: Scalding Spit
desc: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood. As long as you are taking persistent fire damage, you gain a boiling spit ranged unarmed attack with a range of 30 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage.
hint: As long as you are taking persistent fire damage, you gain a boiling spit ranged unarmed attack with a range of 30 feet that deals 1d6 fire damage.
shortdesc: Your bodily fluids burn with surprising volatility, as if you ran on oil instead of blood.

name: Skittering Scuttle
desc: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies. When you use Goblin Scuttle, you can Stride up to half your Speed instead of Stepping.
hint: When you use Goblin Scuttle, you can Stride up to half your Speed instead of Stepping.
shortdesc: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies.

name: Goblin Weapon Expertise
desc: Your goblin affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with goblin weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the dogslicer, horsechopper, and all goblin weapons in which you are trained.
shortdesc: Your goblin affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with goblin weapons.

name: Unbreakable-er Goblin
desc: As hard as most unbreakable goblins are to break, you are that much harder to break. You gain 20 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 10. When you fall, you take no falling damage. If you have the Bouncy Goblin feat, after falling or jumping from a height of at least 20 feet, you can bounce back into the air, up to half the distance you fell (and half as far forward if you jumped). These bounces continue until you bounce less than 20 feet.
hint: When you fall, you take no falling damage. If you have the Bouncy Goblin feat, after falling or jumping from a height of at least 20 feet, you can bounce back into the air, up to half the distance you fell (and half as far forward if you jumped). These bounces continue until you bounce less than 20 feet.
shortdesc: As hard as most unbreakable goblins are to break, you are that much harder to break.

name: Very, Very Sneaky
desc: You can move up to your Speed when you use the Sneak action, and you no longer need to have cover or greater cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak.
hint: You can move up to your Speed when you use the Sneak action, and you no longer need to have cover or greater cover or be concealed to Hide or Sneak.
shortdesc: Your ability to hide is so great, you can disappear straight from vision.

name: Adroit Manipulation
shortdesc: You've fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith's puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do.

name: Distracting Shadows
shortdesc: You have learned to remain hidden by using larger folk as a distraction to avoid drawing attention to yourself.

name: Halfling Lore
shortdesc: You've dutifully learned important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition.

name: Halfling Luck
desc: Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true. You can reroll the triggering check, but you must use the new result, even if it's worse than your first roll.
shortdesc: Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you, and to an extent, that might even be true.

name: Halfling Weapon Familiarity
shortdesc: You favor traditional halfling weapons, so you've learned how to use them more effectively.

name: Innocuous
shortdesc: Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence.

name: Intuitive Cooperation
shortdesc: You are accustomed to working alongside others, relying on each other to get by.

name: Sure Feet
shortdesc: Whether keeping your balance or scrambling up a tricky climb, your hairy, calloused feet easily find purchase.

name: Titan Slinger
shortdesc: You have learned how to use your sling to fell enormous creatures.

name: Unassuming Dedication
shortdesc: Your family instilled the values of care and patience into you from a young age.

name: Unfettered Halfling
shortdesc: You were forced into service as a laborer, but you've since escaped and have trained to ensure you'll never be caught again.

name: Watchful Halfling
shortdesc: Your communal lifestyle causes you to pay close attention to the people around you.

name: Cultural Adaptability
shortdesc: During your adventures, you've honed your ability to adapt to the culture of the predominant ancestry around you.

name: Easily Dismissed
shortdesc: You are practiced at blending into the background of the streets and halls of larger folk to ensure that you are overlooked.

name: Halfling Ingenuity
desc: While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger. You can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained even if you aren't trained in that skill. If you use Halfling Luck when you fail a check for a skill with which you are untrained, you can add a proficiency bonus equal to your level, rather than 0, when you reroll the triggering skill check. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this rerolled skill check.
hint: You can attempt skill actions that normally require you to be trained even if you aren't trained in that skill. If you use Halfling Luck when you fail a check for a skill with which you are untrained, you can add a proficiency bonus equal to your level, rather than 0, when you reroll the triggering skill check. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this rerolled skill check.
shortdesc: While your willingness to dig into a task you know little about might get you into trouble, your incredible luck often saves you from danger.

name: Halfling Weapon Trickster
shortdesc: You are particularly adept at fighting with your people's favored weapons.

name: Shared Luck (Halfling)
desc: You are evidence that it's lucky to travel with a halfling. You can use Halfling Luck when an ally within 30 feet fails a skill check or a saving throw to allow the ally to reroll the triggering check instead of you rerolling your own failed check. As usual, your ally must use the new result, even if it's worse than their first roll. If you have Guiding Luck, you can't use Guiding Luck's effect that applies to attack rolls and Perception checks to use Shared Luck to benefit an ally.
hint: You can use Halfling Luck when an ally within 30 feet fails a skill check or a saving throw to allow the ally to reroll the triggering check instead of you rerolling your own failed check. As usual, your ally must use the new result, even if it's worse than their first roll. If you have Guiding Luck, you can't use Guiding Luck's effect that applies to attack rolls and Perception checks to use Shared Luck to benefit an ally.
shortdesc: You are evidence that it's lucky to travel with a halfling.

name: Cunning Climber
shortdesc: Whether you are climbing a ship's rigging, a jungle tree, or a clock tower, you have an uncanny knack for finding footholds and handholds where larger creatures can't.

name: Fade Away
shortdesc: Your ability to blend into the background allows you to fade away entirely or appear innocuous even to magical effects.

name: Guiding Luck
shortdesc: Your luck guides you to look the right way and aim your blows unerringly.

name: Helpful Halfling
shortdesc: When you aid a friend with a task, you find many ways to help and avoid interfering.

name: Irrepressible
shortdesc: You are easily able to ward off attempts to play on your fears and emotions.

name: Ceaseless Shadows
shortdesc: You excel at going unnoticed, especially among a crowd.

name: Cobble Dancer
shortdesc: You know how to take advantage of foes thrown off-balance by unstable flooring, loose cobblestones, or similar impediments.

name: Halfling Weapon Expertise
shortdesc: Your halfling affinity blends with your class training, granting you great skill with halfling weapons.

name: Incredible Luck (Halfling)
shortdesc: Even other halflings consider you to be particularly lucky.

name: Adapted Cantrip
desc:
Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style. Choose one cantrip from a magical tradition other than your own. If you have a spell repertoire or a spellbook, replace one of the cantrips you know or have in your spellbook with the chosen spell. If you prepare spells without a spellbook (if you're a cleric or druid, for example), one of your cantrips must always be the chosen spell, and you prepare the rest normally. You can cast this cantrip as a spell of your class's tradition.

If you swap or retrain this cantrip later, you can choose its replacement from the same alternate tradition or a different one.
internalNote: Choosing from another tradition as well as losing a cantrip is hardcoded.
shortdesc: Through study of multiple magical traditions, you've altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style.

name: Arcane Tattoos
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic. Choose one of the following schools of magic: abjuration (shield), conjuration (tanglefoot), enchantment (daze), evocation (electric arc), illusion (ghost sound), necromancy (chill touch), or transmutation (sigil). You can cast the associated cantrip (listed in parentheses) as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Abjuration
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of abjuration. You can cast shield as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Conjuration
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of conjuration. You can cast tanglefoot as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Enchantment
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of enchantment. You can cast daze as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Evocation
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of evocation. You can cast electric arc as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Illusion
desc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to the ancient Thassilonian school of illusion. You can cast ghost sound as an innate arcane spell at will.
access: Varisian ethnicity or New Thassilon nationality
shortdesc: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

name: Arcane Tattoos: Necromancy
